name: Nami
title: the Tidecaller

P.name: Surging Tides

effects.description: Innate: Nami's abilities grant 45 (+ 20% AP) bonus movement speed to allied champions for 1.5 seconds whenever they touch them,[ doubled ][ increased to 90 (+ 40% AP) ]when they are touched by Tidal Wave.

P.notes: Surging Tides will apply when an ally champion is targeted by  Ebb and Flow or  Tidecaller's Blessing or when within  Aqua Prison's or  Tidal Wave's area of effect.
P.blurb: When Nami's abilities hit allied champions they gain Movement Speed for a short duration.

Q.name: Aqua Prison

effects.description: Active: Nami sends a bubble towards the target location that lands after 1 second, dealing magic damage to all enemies within the area and revealing and suspending them for 1.5 seconds.

Q.notes:
Aqua Prison provides the status effect that allows  Last Breath to be cast.[2]
An enemy unit with 185.14 or less movement speed (325 affected by a 53.8% slow, due to the low-end movement speed soft cap) would find it impossible to escape Aqua Prison's area of effect.
As a result it might be necessary to have another source of  crowd control in order for Aqua Prison to land. A fully-ranked  Tidecaller's Blessing with 376 AP would be able to  slow for the amount above.
Q.blurb: Sends a bubble to a target area, dealing damage and stunning all enemies on impact.

W.name: Ebb and Flow

effects.description: Active: Nami unleashes a stream of water onto the target champion or herself, which upon arrival then bounces to nearby unaffected champions up to twice, alternating between enemies and allies and Nami.
Ebb and Flow heals allies and deals magic damage to enemies, with each bounce increasing in effectiveness by ((7.5% per 100 AP) - 15)%.

W.notes: Spell shield will block only one bounce. Ebb and Flow will continue to bounce and the target who blocked the ability may be targeted again by a later bounce.
W.blurb: Unleashes a stream of water that bounces back and forth between allied and enemy champions, healing allies and damaging enemies.

E.name: Tidecaller's Blessing

effects.description: Active: Nami blesses the target allied champion or herself for 6 seconds, causing the target's next three basic attacks or abilities to each deal bonus magic damage and slow their target for 1 second.
Empowered abilities that apply area damage only deal 33% − 66% (based on level) of the bonus damage to non-champions.

E.notes:
The enhanced attacks will apply other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage does not).
Tidecaller's Blessing has no effect against structures.
The bonus magic damage benefits from the allied target's  magic penetration, not Nami's.
E.blurb: Empowers an allied champion for a short duration. The ally's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and slow the target.

R.name: Tidal Wave

effects.description: Active: Nami summons a tidal wave that surges forth in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies within its path, knocking them up for 0.5 seconds, and afterwards slowing them for 2 − 4 (based on distance traveled) seconds.

R.notes:
Surging Tides will trigger immediately on Nami on-cast.
The wave travels over 3.2 seconds.
It cannot be dodged by foot at 325 movement speed and 742 range.
The wave places the caster slightly closer to Nami's cast position.
 Suspension does not remove Tidal Wave's  knock up.*
R.blurb: Summons a massive Tidal Wave that knocks up, slows, and damages enemies. Allies hit gain double the effect of Surging Tides.

lore: A headstrong young vastaya of the seas, Nami was the first of the Marai tribe to leave the waves and venture onto dry land, when their ancient accord with the Targonians was broken. With no other option, she took it upon herself to complete the sacred ritual that would ensure the safety of her people. Amidst the chaos of this new age, Nami faces an uncertain future with grit and determination, using her Tidecaller staff to summon the strength of the oceans themselves.

skins.name: Original
skins.lore: A headstrong young vastaya of the seas, Nami was the first of the Marai tribe to leave the waves and venture onto dry land, when their ancient accord with the Targonians was broken. With no other option, she took it upon herself to complete the sacred ritual that would ensure the safety of her people. Amidst the chaos of this new age, Nami faces an uncertain future with grit and determination, using her Tidecaller staff to summon the strength of the oceans themselves.

skins.name: River Spirit
skins.lore: Once upon a time, a young farmer was enchanted by music coming from the deep jungle, and followed it to the grove of a river spirit. Overcome by her beauty, he went to embrace her—and was dragged screaming into the emerald waters below, never to be seen again.

skins.name: Deep Sea
skins.lore: “I saw her! Where light ceases and one is alone with the cold darkness and the sea, she appeared before me—a wordless, ancient thing, pulsing with an unearthly luster as vicious shapes twisted in the gloom beyond.”

skins.name: SKT T1
skins.lore: Honoring Wolf's winning performance as Nami during the 2016 World Championship. This is Wolf's second World Champion skin, following his win with SKT at the 2015 World Championship.

skins.name: Program

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive during 2018.

skins.lore: An aquatic search and rescue med-bot whose manufacturer was acquired in an aggressive corporate takeover, Nami has been irreversibly changed by the directives of Program. For now, she continues in her primary function… though her behavior has become increasingly erratic.

skins.name: Splendid Staff

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in 2019.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2019.

skins.lore: When the demigoddess Irelia was bested by a heavenly empress, the seal over Talon's draconic power began to weaken… allowing some of his magic to leak into the world. Once a mere fish who dreamed of being a dragon, Nami has received some of this power, and has found her true form beginning to awaken.

skins.name: Cosmic Destiny

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2020.

skins.lore: The bringer of life, Nami is charged with scattering the seeds of 'Élan vital' on the newborn, cold lifeless rocks and planets that appear with the birth of new stars and constellations.
